data.title: Alan Partridge
data.meta_description: Alan Partridge is a is a British comedy series created by Armando Iannucci and Steve Coogan. Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge (radio series) (December 1st, 1992 - January 5th, 1993) Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge (TV series) (September 16th, 1994 - December 29th, 1995) Alan...
data.text: Direction Series Date Description Type 1 The Day Today 1994916 September 16, 1994 Alan Partridge is a spin-off of The Day Today. 1 4 James Bond 1994916 September 16, 1994 James Bond is mentioned often in Alan Partridge as Alan’s favourite series and in reference to Roger Moore. 2 4 The Saint 1994916 September 16, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, Alan has The Saint annual in his Roger Moore room which he was going to get Roger to read from. 2 4 Gold (Peter R. Hunt) 1994916 September 16, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, The gold bar in in Alan's 'Roger Moore room' which he explains is a reference to Gold. 2 4 The Wild Geese 1994916 September 16, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, The 3 geese on the wall of Alan's 'Roger Moore room' which he explains is a reference to The Wild Geese. 2 4 Star Trek 1994923 September 23, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, Alan's joke "It's a chat show Jim, but not as we know it" is a spoof of the famously misquoted line from Star Trek: ‘no life as we know it’. 3 4 King Kong 1994930 September 30, 1994 One of Lawrence Knowles's nicknames is "King Kong". 2 4 The Wolf Man 1994930 September 30, 1994 One of Lawrence Knowles's nicknames is "Wolf Man". 2 4 Godzilla 1994930 September 30, 1994 One of Lawrence Knowles's nicknames is "Godzilla". 2 4 Fireball XL5 1994930 September 30, 1994 One of Lawrence Knowles's nicknames is "Furball XL5" 3 4 A Fistful of Dollars 1994107 October 7, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, Alan mentions Clint Eastwood's 'man with no name'. 2 4 The Poseidon Adventure 1994107 October 7, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, Alan says he watched The Poseidon Adventure in his hotel room dubbed in French. 2 4 The Stepford Wives 1994107 October 7, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, Alan says to two women "You're like the Steptoe Wives", she replies "I think you mean The Stepford Wives". 2 4 Gone with the Wind 19941014 October 14, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, Lisa says Alan's moustache looks like Rhett Butler's. 2 4 Chitty Chitty Bang Bang 19941014 October 14, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, Alan says if his show was a car it would be "Chatty Chatty Bang Bang". In I'm Alan Partridge, a listener on Alan's radio show named Sue says that she'd like to watch Chitty Chitty Bang Bang with Sting as part of a phone-in. 2 4 Kojak 19941014 October 14, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, The joke party candidate in the political debate is called "Lt. Colonel Kojak Slaphead III" and has a picture of Telly Savalas on his T-shirt and rosette. 2 4 Baywatch 19941014 October 14, 1994 A character in Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge says Baywatch was his dad's favourite television show. 2 4 The Flintstones 19941021 October 21, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, Alan says "Yabba-dabba-doo", Fred Flintstone's catchphrase. Later on someone tells a joke starting "What does a Swedish Fred Flintstone say?" 2 4 Batman 19941021 October 21, 1994 In Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge, Two guests say how Tim Burton gave them the bat-mobile from this film and say "He directed Batman". 2 4 Doctor Who 19951229 December 29, 1995 In Knowing Me Knowing Yule with Alan Partridge, Alan compares a wheelchair-bound guest to Daleks and Davros. In I'm Alan Partridge, When making robot jokes about Susan, Alan says "Tea or coffee?! Tea or coffee?!" in a Dalek voice. Also in another episode, Alan says that when he had mental health problems he bought the rights to K9, the robot dog. 2 4 Ironside 19952910 10, 1995 In Knowing Me Knowing Yule with Alan Partridge, Ironside is included in Alan's list of heroic disabled people. 2 4 My Left Foot 19951229 December 29, 1995 In Knowing Me Knowing Yule with Alan Partridge, Daniel Day-Lewis is included in Alan's list of heroic disabled people, referencing My Left Foot. 2 4 Noel's House Party 19951229 December 29, 1995 In Knowing Me Knowing Yule with Alan Partridge, Alan asks a guest if they've seen Noel's House Party. 2 4 Mortal Kombat 19951229 December 29, 1995 In Knowing Me Knowing Yule with Alan Partridge, Alan mentions playing Mortal Kombat on his nephews video games console. 2 4 Buck Rogers in the 25th Century 1997113 November 3, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan talking about a toilet "It's very high tech, you could imagine Buck Rodgers taking a dump on that... in the 25th century" 2 4 Shoestring 1997113 November 3, 1997 Alan lists lots of regional detective dramas including Shoestring before he pitches his own to the BBC. 2 4 Bergerac 1997113 November 3, 1997 Alan lists lots of regional detective dramas including Bergerac before he pitches his own to the BBC. 2 4 Taggart 1997113 November 3, 1997 Alan lists lots of regional detective dramas including Taggart before he pitches his own to the BBC. 2 4 Inspector Morse 1997113 November 3, 1997 Alan lists lots of regional detective dramas including Inspector Morse before he pitches his own to the BBC. 2 4 Spender 1997113 November 3, 1997 Alan lists lots of regional detective dramas including Spender before he pitches his own to the BBC. 2 4 Babylon 5 1997113 November 3, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Babylon 5 is advertised in Alan's newspaper. 2 4 Planet of the Apes 19971117 November 17, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan refers to his wife Carol's lover as "Mr. Planet of the Apes Man." 2 4 The Exorcist 19971117 November 17, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan says that Hugh Morris, who has no vocal cords, sounds like the girl in The Exorcist. 2 4 The Bill 19971117 November 17, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Lynn says that Jenny can't film any more scenes in the boating video because she got a part as a shoplifter in The Bill (1984). 2 4 Driving Miss Daisy 19971117 November 17, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan claims he was trying to access Driving Miss Daisy when being told about using an adult pay-channel in the hotel. 2 4 The Eagle Has Landed 19971124 November 24, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Michael does The Eagle Has Landed during a game of charades. 2 4 Conan the Barbarian 19971124 November 24, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Making fun of Alan after the traffic cone incident, Dave Clifton asks him if he watched "Cone-an the Barbarian" 2 4 Thelma & Louise 19971124 November 24, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Michael suggests that he and Alan run off like Thelma and Louise. 2 4 Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em 1997121 December 1, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan lists people who wear berets such as "Saddam Hussein, Frank Spencer and the French." 2 4 Star Wars 1997121 December 1, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan compares Susan to R2-D2. In another episode, Alan walks while bending over and holding his ankles and says "I could have been R2-D2. 2 4 The Crying Game 1997121 December 1, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan asks "Have you seen the film The Crying Game?" to some people in the car, then talks about it. 2 4 The Adventures of Black Beauty 1997128 December 8, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Lynne plays The Adventures of Black Beauty theme tune for Alan. 2 4 Jurassic Park 1997128 December 8, 1997 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan shouts "Jurassic Park!" as an exclamation. 2 5 Adrian Mole 200122 February 2, 2001 In Adrian Mole: The Cappuccino Years, The I'm Alan Partridge series is included in the Ashby-de-la-Zouch Bugle TV listings. 2 4 Herbie 20021111 November 11, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Raphael asks "Can I get to my car?" Alan responds "It's not going to drive off by itself, it's not Herbie." 2 4 Beer 20021111 November 11, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, a Beer VHS is shown. 2 4 Shag 20021111 November 11, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, a Shag VHS is shown. 2 4 The Addams Family 20021111 November 11, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, a The Addams Family VHS is shown. 2 4 The Player 20021111 November 11, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, a The Player VHS is shown. 2 4 Universal Soldier 20021111 November 11, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, a Universal Soldier VHS is shown. 2 4 Animal Instincts 20021111 November 11, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, an Animal Instincts VHS is shown. 2 4 Mary Poppins 20021118 November 18, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan uses "Mary Poppins" as an exclamation when he sees his friend's bike. 2 4 M*A*S*H 20021118 November 18, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan talks about a helicopter and says "Like the beginning of Mash." 2 4 Casualty 20021118 November 18, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, After Lynne gives Alan medical advice, he says "You're just quoting bits from Casualty now." 2 4 Poirot 20021118 November 18, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Lynne asks Alan whether she can watch Poirot. 2 4 The X-Files 20021118 November 18, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan claims his free torch is the same model as used on The X-Files. Also in another episode, after discovering he has various things in common with Dan, Alan says, "It's like The X Files, but a pleasant X Files." 2 4 Dracula (Hammer Film Productions) 20021125 November 25, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan says Karen Colman's house was used in the Hammer "Dracula" films. 2 4 Terminator 20021125 November 25, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, During a bit of horseplay with Alan, Dan says "I'm the Terminator! You can't kill me!" 2 4 Crisis Zone 20021125 November 25, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan plays Crisis Zone at an arcade. 2 4 Return of the Saint 2002122 December 2, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan listens to the Return of the Saint theme tune in his car whilst waiting for Lynne. 2 4 The Dukes of Hazzard 2002122 December 2, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan refers to Tex as "the Duke of Hazzard." 2 4 The Nutty Professor 2002122 December 2, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Sonja buys Nutty Professor II: The Klumps on video in a second hand shop. 2 4 The Deputy Dawg Show 2002129 December 9, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan mentions Deputy Dawg. 2 4 Silent Witness 2002129 December 9, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, After Lynn calls the police, Alan says "This isn't Silent Witness." 2 4 Tweenies 2002129 December 9, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, Alan says his cousin bought a pirated Tweenie doll. 2 4 Shrek 2002129 December 9, 2002 In I'm Alan Partridge, A tax inspector says "Theres a receipt here for a cinema ticket for 1 for Shrek." 2 4 Little Britain 2003930 September 30, 2003 In the Little Britain episode, "Hard-Boiled Egg Eating", in the video rental shop, Alan Partridge's "Crash Bang Wallop! What a Video" can be seen on the shelf. This fictional video was made by Alan. 1 4 The Goodies 2011218 February 18, 2011 In Mid Morning Matters with Alan Partridge, Alan mentions Bill Oddie was one of the Goodies. 2 4 Van der Valk 2011218 February 18, 2011 In Mid Morning Matters with Alan Partridge, Alan plays Eyeline, the music from Van Der Valk (and mentions the show by name), and the tune is also used for the series in some versions. 2 4 The Muppets 2011218 February 18, 2011 In Mid Morning Matters with Alan Partridge, Alan's SAS guest mentions wounded people looking like Muppet's mouths, and Sophie asks if the Muppet was hurt. 2 4 Mrs. Doubtfire 2013624 June 24, 2013 In Alan Partridge: Alpha Papa, Jason Treswell calls Lynn "Mrs. Doubtfire". 2 4 The Godfather 2013624 June 24, 2013 In Alan Partridge: Alpha Papa, The Godfather is referenced in dialogue as a great movie. 2 4 The Shawshank Redemption 2013624 June 24, 2013 In Alan Partridge: Alpha Papa, an inept Alan Partridge escape attempt is dubbed "The Shitshank Redemption". 2 4 The West Wing 2013624 June 24, 2013 In Alan Partridge: Alpha Papa, The West Wing is mentioned when two characters are 'walking and talking.' 2 4 Angry Birds 2013624 June 24, 2013 In Alan Partridge: Alpha Papa, Alan tells Lynn that Pat thinks he borrowed his phone to play Angry Birds on it. 2 4 Django Unchained 2016216 February 16, 2016 In Mid Morning Matters with Alan Partridge, Simon calls Alan "Djangalan Unchained". 2 4 Downton Abbey 2016330 March 30, 2016 In Alan Partridge's Scissored Isle, Alan has named his house "Denton Abbey." 2 6 The Thick of It 201710 October 2017 Armando Iannucci guest-edited an issue of The Big Issue, featuring a debate on Brexit between Partridge and Malcolm Tucker, a character from The Thick of It, another sitcom created by Iannucci. 1 4 The Wizard of Oz 2019225 February 25, 2019 In This Time with Alan Partridge, Alan refers to the 'robot' from The Wizard of Oz. 2 4 Ghost (Paramount) 201934 March 4, 2019 In This Time with Alan Partridge, Ghost is mentioned. 2
